title: Ticket #7746: job_max_vacate_time submit descriptor not honored in local universe
description:
The submit descriptor job_max_vacate_time is not honored for local universe jobs (whether they run under a starter or not). TJ says this is because it is enforced by the startd, and there is no startd in local universe.

The particular case where this came up: a user was running a local universe job and condor_rm'd it. The user process inside the job got stuck while exiting, and since there is effectively no max vacate time, the job was stuck in the X state forever. Force-removal would get the job out of the queue, but not clean up the underlying job, so that's not a good option. Manually killing the user process inside the job let the starter exit cleanly.
